intro: Tylophora globifera, commonly known as the globeflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, spherical flower clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in clusters, making it an ornamental plant in some regions.
